ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The physics, the history, and the contemporary state of Global Warming; as well as how this is affected by our use of engines and the energy that powers them.

A sense of the world's energy landscape and its trajectory in the future. General comprehension of the advantages and disadvantages of current and future energy technologies. Understanding of the Earth climate system.  Basic competency in thermodynamics.
I learned basic thermodynamics and the limitations of major renewable and carbon-free energies.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I'm not a native speaker so the accent of professor is a really big problem, especially online. The quanlity of sound is worse through the zoom

Strengths: engaging course material with very high relevance in industry/society; capable/competent instructor; final project which allowed students to explore personal interests.

The only weakness was online format which is not instructor's fault.
The course was very fast-paced so there could've been more opportunities for engagement and clarification.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I believe that energy technologies and climate science are very useful, even for non-science students.
I would if the student has a lot of time to dedicate to studying or has prior experience with thermodynamics.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: ENAS S101 01/ENVE S101 01/EVST S105 01/MENG S101 01 - Energy, Engines & Environment
